main event: A round, blue flash of light that seemed to get brighter was observed in Omaha, Nebraska on November 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object was stationary in the sky.
The observer was coming home from the store when they saw the object.
The object was observed for an unknown duration, but it was still in sight.
The report indicates the sighting was checked against Omaha Tower, which believed the object was likely the planet Venus.
An astro plot confirmed Venus was in the southwest sky at the time of the sighting, approximately 30 degrees above the horizon.
